hints.label: thm-qsd-existence
hints.title: Existence and Uniqueness of the QSD
hints.content:
2107: :label: thm-qsd-existence
2108: 
2109: The Geometric Viscous Fluid Model, composed with the cloning operator $\Psi_{\text{clone}}$, admits a unique Quasi-Stationary Distribution (QSD) $\pi_{\text{QSD}}$ on the phase space $\mathcal{X} \times \mathbb{R}^d$.
2110: 
2111: Moreover, for any initial distribution $\mu_0$, the law of the swarm at time $t$ converges exponentially fast to $\pi_{\text{QSD}}$ in total variation:
2112: 
2113: $$
2114: \|\mu_t - \pi_{\text{QSD}}\|_{\text{TV}} \le C_{\text{TV}} (1 - \kappa_{\text{total}})^t
2115: $$

hints.label: conj-wfr-convergence
hints.title: Convergence in the WFR Metric
hints.content:
2134: :label: conj-wfr-convergence
2135: 
2136: The composition of the kinetic evolution $\Psi_{\text{kin,adapt}}$ and the cloning selection $\Psi_{\text{clone}}$ is a contraction in the Wasserstein-Fisher-Rao (WFR) metric. Consequently, the empirical distribution converges in WFR distance:
2137: 
2138: $$
2139: \text{WFR}(\mu_t, \pi_{\text{QSD}}) \le C_{\text{WFR}} e^{-\lambda_{\text{WFR}} t}
2140: $$
hints.section: ## 9. Main Convergence Theorems and Physical Interpretation
hints.raw_directive:
2131: The Wasserstein-Fisher-Rao (WFR) metric is a natural geometric framework for analyzing the convergence of probability distributions evolving under reaction-diffusion dynamics. We now state a formal conjecture regarding WFR convergence for the adaptive system.
2132: 
2133: :::{prf:conjecture} Convergence in the WFR Metric
2134: :label: conj-wfr-convergence
2135: 
2136: The composition of the kinetic evolution $\Psi_{\text{kin,adapt}}$ and the cloning selection $\Psi_{\text{clone}}$ is a contraction in the Wasserstein-Fisher-Rao (WFR) metric. Consequently, the empirical distribution converges in WFR distance:
2137: 
2138: $$
2139: \text{WFR}(\mu_t, \pi_{\text{QSD}}) \le C_{\text{WFR}} e^{-\lambda_{\text{WFR}} t}
2140: $$
2141:

hints.label: rem-wfr-analogy
hints.title: Formal Analogy and Evidence
hints.content:
2171: :label: rem-wfr-analogy
2172: 
2173: Despite the lack of a complete proof, there is strong formal evidence for the conjecture:
2174: 
2175: **Structural analogy:** The adaptive system has the form of a **gradient flow in WFR space**:
2176: - The kinetic evolution is a gradient flow of the free energy in Wasserstein space
2177: - The cloning operator is a gradient flow of relative entropy in Fisher-Rao space
2178: - The WFR metric naturally interpolates between these two geometries
2179: 
2180: **Partial results:**
2181: - For the **backbone system** (without adaptive terms), W₂ contractivity follows from standard theory
2182: - For **simplified selection operators** (e.g., resampling with absolute fitness), FR contractivity is well-established
2183: - The uniform ellipticity (Theorem [](#thm-ueph)) provides the regularity needed for Wasserstein contractivity
2184: 
2185: **What would complete the proof:**
2186: 1. Extend W₂ contraction theory to uniformly elliptic, state-dependent diffusions (possible via Otto calculus)
2187: 2. Prove FR contractivity for competitive, state-dependent selection operators
2188: 3. Apply the Chizat-Peyré-Schmitzer WFR theory to verify the composition

hints.label: thm-lsi-mean-field
hints.title: Logarithmic Sobolev Inequality for the Mean-Field Generator
hints.content:
2218: :label: thm-lsi-mean-field
2219: 
2220: For the mean-field limit of the Geometric Viscous Fluid Model (as $N \to \infty$), the mean-field generator $\mathcal{L}_{\text{MF}}$ satisfies a logarithmic Sobolev inequality with respect to its unique stationary state $\rho_{\text{QSD}}$. There exists a constant $\lambda_{\text{LSI}} > 0$ such that for all probability densities $f \in H^1_w(\mathcal{X} \times \mathbb{R}^d)$:
2221: 
2222: $$
2223: \text{Ent}_{\rho_{\text{QSD}}}(f) \le \frac{1}{2\lambda_{\text{LSI}}} D(f)
2224: $$
2225: 
2226: where:
2227: - $\text{Ent}_{\rho}(f) := \int f \log(f / \rho) \, dx \, dv$ is the relative entropy.
2228: - $D(f) := -\int (\mathcal{L}_{\text{MF}} f) \log(f / \rho_{\text{QSD}}) \, dx \, dv$ is the entropy dissipation (Fisher information).
hints.section: ## 9. Main Convergence Theorems and Physical Interpretation
hints.raw_directive:
2215: The natural next question is: **Does the LSI survive in the mean-field limit as $N \to \infty$?** This section discusses this open problem.

2217: :::{prf:theorem} Logarithmic Sobolev Inequality for the Mean-Field Generator
2218: :label: thm-lsi-mean-field
2219: 
2220: For the mean-field limit of the Geometric Viscous Fluid Model (as $N \to \infty$), the mean-field generator $\mathcal{L}_{\text{MF}}$ satisfies a logarithmic Sobolev inequality with respect to its unique stationary state $\rho_{\text{QSD}}$. There exists a constant $\lambda_{\text{LSI}} > 0$ such that for all probability densities $f \in H^1_w(\mathcal{X} \times \mathbb{R}^d)$:
2221: 
2222: $$
2223: \text{Ent}_{\rho_{\text{QSD}}}(f) \le \frac{1}{2\lambda_{\text{LSI}}} D(f)
2224: $$
2225: 
2226: where:
2227: - $\text{Ent}_{\rho}(f) := \int f \log(f / \rho) \, dx \, dv$ is the relative entropy.
2228: - $D(f) := -\int (\mathcal{L}_{\text{MF}} f) \log(f / \rho_{\text{QSD}}) \, dx \, dv$ is the entropy dissipation (Fisher information).

hints.label: lem-dissipation-decomp
hints.title: Decomposition of Entropy Dissipation
hints.content:
2272: :label: lem-dissipation-decomp
2273: 
2274: The total entropy dissipation can be decomposed as:
2275: 
2276: $$
2277: D(f) = D_{\text{kin}}(f) + D_{\text{clone}}(f) + D_{\text{boundary}}(f)
2278: $$
2279: 
2280: where:
2281: - $D_{\text{kin}}(f) = \int f \|\nabla_v \log(f / \rho_{\text{QSD}})\|^2_{G_{\text{reg}}} \, dx \, dv$ is the kinetic dissipation.
2282: - $D_{\text{clone}}(f) \ge 0$ is the dissipation from the selection/cloning mechanism.
2283: - $D_{\text{boundary}}(f) \ge 0$ is the dissipation from boundary flux.

hints.label: def-microlocal
hints.title: Microlocal Decomposition
hints.content:
2291: :label: def-microlocal
2292: 
2293: For any function $h = f / \rho_{\text{QSD}}$, define:
2294: - **Hydrodynamic projection:** $\Pi h(x) := \int_{\mathbb{R}^d} h(x, v) \rho_{\text{QSD}}(v | x) \, dv$
2295: - **Microscopic fluctuation:** $(I - \Pi) h := h - \Pi h$

hints.label: lem-micro-coercivity
hints.title: Microscopic Coercivity (Step A)
hints.content:
2305: :label: lem-micro-coercivity
2306: 
2307: There exists $\lambda_{\text{mic}} > 0$ such that:
2308: 
2309: $$
2310: D_{\text{kin}}(h \cdot \rho_{\text{QSD}}) \ge \lambda_{\text{mic}} \|(I - \Pi) h\|^2_{L^2(\rho_{\text{QSD}})}
2311: $$

hints.title: Macroscopic Transport (Step B)
hints.content:
2317: :label: lem-macro-transport
2318: 
2319: There exists $C_1 > 0$ such that:
2320: 
2321: $$
2322: \|\Pi h\|^2_{L^2(\rho_{\text{QSD}})} \le C_1 \left| \langle (I - \Pi) h, v \cdot \nabla_x (\Pi h) \rangle_{L^2(\rho_{\text{QSD}})} \right|
2323: $$
